hotspots.label: Eggshell Fragment
hotspots.fact: This broken eggshell shows where a baby bird hatched and broke free! Eggshells are made of calcium, which makes them hard and protective for the growing baby inside.

hotspots.label: Nestling or Chick
hotspots.fact: This appears to be a young bird that recently hatched. Baby birds are covered in soft down feathers and depend on their parents for food and warmth until they grow stronger.

hotspots.label: Nest Materials
hotspots.fact: Birds build nests from grass, twigs, and plant material to create a safe home for their eggs. This natural mulch and debris help insulate and protect the nest from weather.

hotspots.label: Wood Chips
hotspots.fact: The wood chips in this area help birds by providing good drainage and preventing moisture from harming eggs. Many ground-nesting birds prefer areas with natural mulch for protection.
